info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 2:19AM EDT until April 6 at 9:02PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Mill Creek near Cataract.
Wildcat Creek near Jerome.
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
.Widespread and significant flooding is in progress. Rainfall amounts of three to over six inches have fallen over the past few days.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wildcat Creek near Jerome.
* WHEN...Until late this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Extensive flooding of Wildcat Creek in Jerome area. CR 1050 E just south of Jerome begins to flood. Extensive flooding of canoe launch site and park near SR 213.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 AM EDT Sunday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 530 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING
